user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_irq_register:
```c
int metal_irq_register(int irq,
		       metal_irq_handler irq_handler,
		       void *arg)
{
	struct metal_irq_controller *cntr;
	struct metal_irq *irq_data;

	cntr = metal_irq_get_controller(irq);
	if (cntr == NULL) {
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	if (cntr->irq_register != NULL) {
		return cntr->irq_register(cntr, irq, irq_handler, arg);
	}
	if (cntr->irqs == NULL) {
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	irq_data = &cntr->irqs[irq - cntr->irq_base];
	irq_data->hd = irq_handler;
	irq_data->arg = arg;
	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_irq_register:
static struct metal_irq_controller *metal_irq_get_controller(int irq)
{
	struct metal_list *node;
	struct metal_irq_controller *cntr;

	metal_list_for_each(&irq_cntrs, node) {
		int irq_base, irq_end;

		cntr = (struct metal_irq_controller *)
		       metal_container_of(node, struct metal_irq_controller,
					  node);
		irq_base = cntr->irq_base;
		irq_end = irq_base + cntr->irq_num;
		if (irq >= irq_base && irq < irq_end) {
			return cntr;
		}
	}
	return NULL;
}
...
struct metal_irq_controller {
	int irq_base; /**< Start of IRQ number of the range managed by
		 	* the IRQ controller
		 	*/
	int irq_num; /**< Number of IRQs managed by the IRQ controller */
	void *arg; /**< Argument to pass to interrupt controller function */
	metal_irq_set_enable irq_set_enable; /**< function to set IRQ enable */
	metal_cntr_irq_register irq_register; /**< function to register IRQ
						* handler
						*/
	struct metal_list node; /**< list node */
	struct metal_irq *irqs; /**< Array of IRQs managed by the controller */
}
...
struct metal_irq {
	metal_irq_handler hd; /**< Interrupt handler */
	void *arg; /**< Argument to pass to the interrupt handler */
}
...
typedef int (*metal_irq_handler) (int irq, void *arg)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No function parameter is assigned to or otherwise modified in the provided code. Specifically:
- The formal parameters of metal_irq_register (irq, irq_handler, arg) are only read: used to look up the controller, passed to cntr->irq_register, or copied into irq_data->hd and irq_data->arg. None of these operations assign to the parameter variables themselves.
- The call to cntr->irq_register passes the parameters onward but does not constitute modification of the parameters within metal_irq_register (MISRA Rule 17.8 concerns modification of the function’s own parameters). Any effects inside the callee are outside the scope of this rule for the current function.
- metal_irq_get_controller(int irq) also only reads irq (uses it in comparisons) and does not modify the parameter.
- Assignments to fields of structures (irq_data->hd and irq_data->arg) modify objects other than the function parameters; that is allowed by the rule (the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, and copying a parameter value into another object does not modify the parameter itself).
Therefore there are no code fragments in the supplied code that require investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
